p: Although severe acute respiratory illness (SARI) is a major cause of death and morbidity in low- and middle-income countries, the etiology of SARI is often unconfirmed due to the lack of molecular testing capabilities in under-resourced regions. Hospitals and clinics often rely on broad nationwide influenza surveillance data to describe pneumonia and SARI outbreaks, neglecting onsite molecular diagnosis of influenza and non-influenza respiratory viruses as potential etiologic agents. However, efforts beyond utilizing influenza surveillance to describe pneumonia and SARI in Vietnam have been demonstrated as feasible and efficient by the Vietnam Ministry of Health[ 1].
